folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West street, Clarkson street, North of intersection, (Before Reconstruction).
President Borough of Manhattan.
June 24, 1918.

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text: West Street, Clarkson to Leroy Street before reconstruction

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
West Street, south from Clarkson Street, showing the new vehicular highway under construction. Intersection shown in the left foreground is West Houston Street; Pier No. 39 North River being at the foot of same.
About 1929.
(2)
A view hnorthward at the northern end of this link (about Jane Street). The Southern Pacific Steamship Company occupies Pier No. 49 .
About 1929.

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
West Street, north from Clarkson Street, and showing the new vehicular highway. Plainly observable is Pier No. 41 on the left.
About 1929.
(2)
A view northward from about (Pier No. 38) King Street, and under
the afore mentioned structure.
About 1929.
(3)
A view at the northern end of this link. View is taken at about Jane Street. Note the Southern Pacific S.S. Co. Pier No. 49 on the left.
About 1929.

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Street, north from Clarkson Street, showing the West Side Elevated Vehicular Highway under construction. Intersection in the right foreground is Leroy Street. Pier No. 41 North River (Lackawanna Railroad Co.) which is at the foot of this street is partially shown on the left. This is a set of 3 views; No. 2 and 3 being at the northern end of this link (about Jane Street). The Southern Pacific Steamship Co. occupies Pier No. 49.
About 1929.
View #1-
View #2-
View #3-
Neg #2465

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Pier 40, North River, West Street, west side, opposite Clarkson
Street.
March 6, 1929.
. P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Northern end of Pier 40, and the railroad flagman's sentry box, West Street, west side, opposite and north of Clarkson Street.
March 9, 1929.
L. Sperr.

folder: Clarkson Street & West Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Clarkson Street, east from West Street. The northern end of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal will be along the south side of Clarkson Street; and the elevated roadbed will conduct the tracks along the west side of Washington Street. This accounts for the demolition of 71 to 61 Clarkson Street, on the north side, adjoining and at the corner of Washington Street.
September 30, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Street, east side, from Clarkson Street, opposite Pier 40, North Rivcr, to West Houston Street (formerly Hammersly Street), opposite Pier 39. Demolition has begun on this entire block, which is the northermost block included in the future site of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal. In the right background a building on the north side of Charlton Street, just east of West, is being demolished. In the left background the Standard Statistics Building on Hudson Street (q.v.) may
be seen under construction.
September 30, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
350 West Street, east side, adjoining the south corner of Clarkson Street, opposite Pier 40, North River. This is a frame house with stucco facing. It is shortly to be demolished, being a part of the site of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal.
On some maps it is shown as No. 349.
June 3, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

#357 West Street,East Side between Clarkson and Leroy Streets.
(Opposite Piers 40-41 North River.)
June 3rd, 1930

May 7th, 1940
Photographs by,

folder: West Street & Clarkson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Street, east side, from Clarkson Street, opposite Pier 40, North River, to Watts Street (Pier 31). All the old buildings from Clarkson to Charlton Streets have been cleared away long since, and construction of the new St. John's Park Freight Terminal is beginning at the Charlton Street end.
June 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
